synopses.small: Joel Taggart and Chris Morgan discuss the big talking points in the Irish Premiership.
synopses.medium: Joel Taggart and Chris Morgan discuss the big talking points in the Irish Premiership as Linfield are held by 10-man Ballinamallard and Cliftonville close the gap at the top.
synopses.large: Joel Taggart and Chris Morgan discuss the big talking points in the Irish Premiership as Linfield are held by 10-man Ballinamallard and Cliftonville close the gap at the top.

episodes.title: World on 3

synopses.small: The 1922 silent film Nanook of the North with a new score by Inuk singer, Tanya Tagaq.
synopses.medium: Nanook of the North, a 1922 silent film, chronicled the traditional ways of the Canadian Inuit as they were disappearing, with a new soundtrack by Canadian singer, Tanya Tagaq.
synopses.large:
Nanook of the North, a 1922 silent film made by American film-maker Robert J Flaherty, chronicled the traditional ways of the Canadian Inuit just as they were disappearing for ever. It follows the lives of Nanook and his ‘family’ living in some of the harshest landscapes on earth. 



This version features an entirely new soundtrack by Canadian Inuk throat-singer, Tanya Tagaq, recorded in association with The Banff Centre, Canada. 



Part of the Radio 3 Northern Lights season.

episodes.subtitle: Tanya Tagaq and Nanook of the North

text.large: Contains some scenes which some viewers may find upsetting.
